skill.name: test-driven-development
skill.description: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code
skill.summary: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code
skill.author: obra

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and guidelines for Test-Driven Development practices. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or other potentially risky operations were found. The skill is pure educational content about TDD methodology.

content.value_statement: Writing tests after code leads to bugs and poor design. This skill enforces strict TDD discipline, ensuring you write failing tests first and implement minimal code to pass.
actual_capabilities: Prevents code before tests with iron law enforcement
Identifies testing anti-patterns and provides fixes
Ensures tests verify real behavior not mocks
limitations: Requires deleting any code written before tests
No exceptions without human partner permission
Must watch every test fail before implementation
Strict discipline may slow initial development

use_cases.title: Feature Development with TDD
use_cases.description: Implement new features using strict test-first approach to ensure reliability and proper design

use_cases.title: Regression-Proof Bug Fixes
use_cases.description: Write failing tests that reproduce bugs before fixing them to prevent future regressions

use_cases.title: Enforce Testing Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all code changes follow TDD principles and avoid common testing anti-patterns

prompt_templates.title: Basic TDD Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add a function that calculates fibonacci numbers. Use TDD - write the test first, watch it fail, then implement minimal code to pass.

prompt_templates.title: Bug Fix with TDD
prompt_templates.prompt: Users report that the login form accepts empty passwords. Write a failing test that demonstrates this bug, then fix it following TDD principles.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring with Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to refactor the user service to use dependency injection. First write tests for the current behavior, then refactor while keeping tests green.

prompt_templates.title: Complex Feature TDD
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a rate limiter using TDD. Start with the simplest case (single request), then add tests for burst handling, window resets, and concurrent requests.

output_examples.input: Add validation to reject emails without @ symbol using TDD
output: RED: Write failing test - test('rejects email without @ symbol', () => { expect(validateEmail('invalid.com')).toBe(false); })
Verify RED: Test fails as expected - validateEmail returns true for invalid input
GREEN: Add minimal validation - if (!email.includes('@')) return false;
Verify GREEN: Test passes, all other tests still pass
REFACTOR: Extract validation logic, improve error messages while keeping tests green

best_practices: Always watch the test fail before writing implementation code
Write minimal code - just enough to make the test pass
Test real behavior, avoid testing mock implementations
Use clear test names that describe the expected behavior
anti_patterns: Writing code before tests - violates the iron law of TDD
Testing mock behavior instead of real functionality
Adding test-only methods to production classes
Skipping the verification step after writing tests

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all testing frameworks?
faq.answer: Yes, the TDD principles work with any testing framework including Jest, Mocha, pytest, or JUnit.

faq.question: What are the limitations of TDD?
faq.answer: TDD requires discipline and may slow initial development, but prevents bugs and enables confident refactoring.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing code without tests?
faq.answer: Add characterization tests first to document current behavior, then follow TDD for new changes.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only provides testing guidelines and doesn't access or modify any data.

faq.question: What if I get stuck writing a test?
faq.answer: Simplify the design or ask your human partner. Hard-to-test code often indicates design issues.

faq.question: How is this different from just having tests?
faq.answer: TDD ensures tests actually verify behavior by watching them fail first, unlike tests written after implementation.
